Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The user frequently SWITCHES between apps or CLOSES an application after completing work, indicating natural process boundaries.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The pattern of app interactions (FOCUS, SWITCH, CLOSE) suggests that each FOCUS event could represent the start of a logical 'case' in the workflow.

Name: Validation - IND
Text: To test the hypothesis, events were sequentially examined to ensure each FOCUS consistently starts a new grouping of events.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The logical grouping rule (group events until SWITCH or CLOSE) was consistently applied to ensure process cohesiveness.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: Activity names were inferred from raw actions (e.g., TYPING as 'Edit Document') to create a standardized, meaningful activity list.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Each proposed case and activity was verified for continuity and logical consistency within the workflow.

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: When SWITCH events were initially left undecided, reasoning backtracked to ensure they were assigned to the appropriate cases.
